column4: i take it ubuntu and wireless are about as easy as any other dist and wireless
Actually, wireless under ubuntu is pretty painless
i have a crappy mini-pci Ralink card in one of my computers, and even that works flawlessly.
Yeah, broken_ladder, that was where I looked immediately
I've toyed with my theme config file.
then why can i see my access point SSID but when i try to connect it just scrolls and will not connect?
open a console and type iwconfig
what does it say?
the box is powered down as of now..been messing with it all day...in WIn now
Disc: Ubuntu can use either.
what are some things to try when i get back into ubuntu?
Try setting all the options manually with iwconfig
use lsmod to check that your wireless cards module is detected properly
My card has a little glitch where you actually have to deactivate and reactivate the card every time I reboot to get it to work.  I 'm sure I could automate a script to do that, but, too lazy
i'll try that stuff thanks...its been a headache, i can see all 3 of my access points but cannot connect to them
What brand of card is it?
And is this a laptop you're talking about?
its a mini pci card in a emachine laptop (not sure of brand of card)
Eesh. You might wanna look for a custom driver.
It might be the same ralink mini-pci card I have
so i may still see the access points and signal strength even though my card may not be properly installed?
